intro: Oreodaphne nutans var. sylvestris, commonly known as the forest oreodaphne, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. This species is often found in lowland and hill forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
